DLG ITM_3

DLG SPR_1
"""
{sequence
  - The sign says "Freepoint lighthouse".
    It's a good thing the storm hasn't blown away this sign,
    or you'd have no idea where you are.
    It's not like this is obviously a lighthouse or something.
  - The sign says "Freepoint lighthouse".
}
"""

DLG SPR_0
"""
{
  - tape == 1 ?
    Better to walk around instead of cutting it.
  - else ?
    Police tape. Meant to keep other people out, not you.{tape = 1}
}
"""

DLG SPR_2
"""
{
  - tape == 1 ?
    Better to walk around instead of cutting it.
  - else ?
    Police tape. Meant to keep other people out, not you.{tape = 1}
}
"""

DLG SPR_3
"""
{
  - tape == 1 ?
    Better to walk around instead of cutting it.
  - else ?
    Police tape. Meant to keep other people out, not you.{tape = 1}
}
"""

DLG SPR_4
"""
{
  - thief == 1 ?
    You know how she died now, which is all that you came for. You decide to leave before you discover anything else. (end "You turn your back on the lighthouse and try to forget.")
  - else ?
    Can't go back yet, you have a job to do.
}
"""

DLG SPR_5
"""
{
  - thief == 1 ?
    You know how she died now, which is all that you came for. You decide to leave before you discover anything else. (end "You turn your back on the lighthouse and try to forget.")
  - else ?
    Can't go back yet, you have a job to do.
}
"""

DLG SPR_6
"""
{sequence
  - It's too dark to see, you should find the light switch.
  - It's too dark to see, you should find the light switch.
  - Is that a light switch to your right?
}
"""

DLG SPR_7
Better stay inside, away from the rain.

DLG SPR_9
"""
{
  - thief == 1 ?
    Rain or not, you've seen enough.
    (exit "outside,7,9,")
  - sight == 1 ?
    The sturdy front doors are covered in words, some you can read, some you can't. It's hard to keep the words in your mind, and you realize they are about forgetting.
  - else ?
    Better stay inside, away from the rain.
}
"""

DLG SPR_a
Better stay inside, away from the rain.

DLG SPR_b
Best to keep the lights on, you won't find any clues if you're fumbling around in the dark.

DLG SPR_c
"""
{
  - thief == 1 ?
    Rain or not, you've seen enough.
    (exit "outside,7,9,")
  - sight == 1 ?
    The sturdy front doors are covered in words, some you can read, some you can't. It's hard to keep the words in your mind, and you realize they are about forgetting.
  - else ?
    Better stay inside, away from the rain.
}
"""

DLG ITM_1
"""
A spray bottle of luminol.

It can be used to find traces of blood.
(Why are the local cops leaving their shit everywhere?)
"""

DLG SPR_d
"""
There's wood in the fireplace.

You strike a match and {clr3}light it{clr3}.
{fireplace = 1}(exit "litkitchen,5,6")
"""

DLG SPR_e
"""
{
  - fireplace == 1 ?
    (exitNow "litkitchen,7,12")
  - else ?
    (exitNow "kitchen,7,12")
}
"""

DLG SPR_f
"""
{
  - fireplace == 1 ?
    (exitNow "litkitchen,8,12")
  - else ?
    (exitNow "kitchen,8,12")
}
"""

DLG SPR_g
"""
{
  - pantryunlock == 1 ?
    (exitNow "pantry,9,4")
  - {item "pantry key"} == 1 ?
    You try your small key... 
    
    It fits!
    The door is unlocked.{pantryunlock = 1}(exit "pantry,9,4")
  - else ?
    Looks like some kind of pantry, but the door is locked.
    (Who locks a pantry?)
}
"""

DLG ITM_0
"""
It's a small, metal key.

Maybe you can open a simple door with this?
"""

DLG SPR_8
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    The {clr3}yellow light{clr3} from the lamp makes the room feel warm and inviting.
  - else ?
    An old floor lamp, with yellow glass and a tasseled pull chain.
}
"""

DLG SPR_h
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    The {clr3}light{clr3} is perfect to read by. 
    
    You almost want to sit down and crack open a book.
  - else ?
    An old, tacky lamp.
}
"""

DLG SPR_i
"""
Just more books.

The old woman sure liked her books.
"""

DLG SPR_k
Who needs this many books?

DLG SPR_l
"""
{
  - hassini == 1 ?
    The labels says "Shrubby yellowcrest". 
  - else ?
    The labels says "Shrubby yellowcrest". {hassini = 1}
    {herbs = herbs + 1}Inside is a finely chopped mixture of flower and foliage. It has a plain, grassy smell. You take some from the jar. 
}
"""

DLG SPR_m
"""
{
  - hasbean == 1 ?
    The label says "Ordeal bean".
  - else ?
    The label says "Ordeal bean".
    {hasbean = 1}
{herbs = herbs + 1}
    
    This jar, unlike the others, is very small and almost entirely empty. It contains only a few beans, normal in size and deep brown in color. The name seems somewhat menacing for a bean. You take some from the jar. 
}
"""

DLG SPR_n
"""
{
  - flour == 1 ?
    You'd rather just leave the jar alone now.
  - thief == 1 ?
    You plunge your hand into the flour.
    The initial feeling is cool and damp. The flour itself is gritty, and you can feel all sorts of insects wriggling slightly against your hand. You feel around until your fingers touch metal. You pull something out. (exit "pantry2,10,3"){flour = 1}
  - else ?
    It's an old jar of flour.
    
    A quick glance tells you that it's slightly damp, and that lots of small somethings are moving around inside of it.
    You're not touching that without a really good reason.
}
"""

DLG SPR_o
"""
{
  - hasbella == 1 ?
    The label says "Beautiful lady".
  - else ?
    The label says "Beautiful lady".
    {hasbella = 1}
{herbs = herbs + 1}
    
    This jar contains some dried flowers, but on top of the flowers there are ten shiny, black berries. They aren't dried, and must have been picked just a few days ago. You take some from the jar. 
}
"""

DLG SPR_p
"""
{
  - hasfox == 1 ?
    The label says "Foxglove".
  - else ?
    The label says "Foxglove".
    {hasfox = 1}
{herbs = herbs + 1}
    
    The jar is full of dried flowers, purple trumpets with no scent. You take some from the jar. 
}
"""

DLG SPR_q
"""
{
  - hasmary == 1 ?
    The label says "Mary's gold".
  - else ?
    The label says "Mary's gold".
    {hasmary = 1}
{herbs = herbs + 1}
    
    Inside the jar are some dried petals. They might have been yellow once. When you open the jar you can tell they have a strong, unpleasant smell. You take some from the jar. 
}
"""

DLG SPR_r
"""
{
  - pantryunlock == 1 ?
    (exitNow "pantry,9,4")
  - {item "pantry key"} == 1 ?
    You try your small key... 
    
    It fits!
    The door is unlocked.{pantryunlock = 1}(exit "pantry,9,4")
  - else ?
    Looks like some kind of pantry, but the door is locked.
    (Who locks a pantry?)
}
"""

DLG SPR_s
"""
{
  - fireplace == 1 ?
    (exitNow "litkitchen,9,5")
  - else ?
    (exitNow "kitchen,9,5")
}
"""

DLG SPR_j
Of course they'd send you out to the edge of fucking nowhere in the middle of a storm. Best to just get this over with.

DLG SPR_u
Six chairs and a large table. It's a decent dining room, but the minimal lighting makes it somewhat uncomfortable.

DLG SPR_w
An empty bookcase.

DLG SPR_y
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    This old book has a brown leather cover. You open it and inside are several journal entries. You read one:
    {cycle
      - "{clr3}1/23/1810{clr3}
        
        {knowmari = 1}The townsfolk are talking about it now: another child missing, another child presumed dead. I would think after losing so many they would hold tight to those they still have. They do not. The child from yesterday stole from me, and I made such a strong brew of {clr3}marigold{clr3} to find him. I boiled two cups and drank them so fast I burnt my mouth. It was worth it to see his face when I stole from him in turn."
        
        ({clr3}Marigold{clr3}? She used it to find something stolen?)
      - "{clr3}8/9/1823{clr3}
        
        How did I get here? It seems so long ago that I began my wandering. I wish I could rest, but I know that if I stop, I may never rise again. I must be committed to this life above all things. The world grows larger everyday. 
        Soon all those who knew me will be dead."
        (Wait, how old could she be?)
      - "{clr3}4/9/1801{clr3}
        
        It's a sickening feeling, not unlike hunger. I am a plant, slowly withering without the things I need. If I tried I could stay young forever, but at great cost. If I time it, I could go eighty, aging years without stealing a soul.
        It's hard to resist, though. The withering feeling is like a thirst, an ache all over me. I continue, but can feel the desperation of evil inside of me. It will take my whole will to remain unlike a monster."
        
        (She talks about stealing souls. Is such a thing possible?)
      - "{clr3}[undated]{clr3}
        
        There is a new family moving in to the house a half mile away. They have a young daughter, Rebecca. It feels like a sign of fate, having a young girl so close. This body will fail soon, and I will need to move in with her.
        (What exactly does she mean by "move in"?)
    }
  - else ?
    This old book has a brown leather cover. It has a homemade look and feel to it. 
    
    When you open it, you find that {clr3}every page is empty{clr3}.
}
"""

DLG SPR_z
"""
{shuffle
  - You pick up an illustrated guide to quilting. No thanks.
  - You pick up a cookbook. Or is it a book on folk medicine? It's hard to tell.
  - You pick up a book on the history of witchcraft. Spooky.
  - You pick up a children's picture book about... faeries? Pass.
}
"""

DLG SPR_10
"""
This book has a bright yellow cover and is titled 
{clr3}"Seeing the Unseen"{clr3}. You flip it open and read a passage: 
{cycle
  - "When aiming to see ghosts and other dead, it is best to burn large amounts of masterwort over a small piece of cedar wood until your eyes begin to water. Look through your tears to reveal them. Be wary, though, as they may still deceive you."
    (Sounds fake, but okay.)
  - {knowsini = 1}"To view spelled writing when the sun is not at its zenith, you must open your eyes to the revealing sun. Use a tea of {clr3}shrubby yellowcrest, the sun opener,{clr3} to induce the vision, and you will be able to see all truth with golden sight."
    (See all truth? That would make your job easier.)
  - "For visions into the self, there are two routes. The first is a sleeping dream. Leaf of god tastes bitter but is tried and true. The second is that of the waking dream, by taking the root of the iboga tree. You must be ready for what you see, as we are not always prepared to look inside ourselves."
    (That's for fucking sure.)
}
"""

DLG SPR_11
"""
{shuffle
  - You pick up a textbook on human physiology. Neat.
  - You pick up a romance novel.
    ...
    Wow, what a cover. You quickly put it back.
  - You pick up a guide to figure drawing. 
    Interesting, but not useful right now.
  - You pick up a brochure for a 5-day cruise along the coast.
}
"""

DLG SPR_x
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    This old book has a black cover. Its contents are about ways to postpone or cheat death. You open it and read a passage:
    {cycle
      - "{clr3}Chapter 4: theft of body{clr3}
        
        A body thief is one who shifts their soul between different mortal bodies. Some displace the present soul, sending it wherever it may go. Others are not so kind, and choose to hold it hostage, lest the body reject its foreign contents.
        To transfer the thief's soul, a small part must be removed from the whole. Normally it must be {clr3}imbibed{clr3} or inhaled, and then the previous vessel must be killed."
      - {clr3}"Chapter 10: blood and poison{clr3}
        
        {knowdeath = 1}Those who drink blood to stay alive are called many names. "Vampire" is the one that comes to mind, but like all legends, it contains only a piece of the truth. It comes down to a simple idea: taking the life from another. The very form must be rebuilt and destroyed for one to accept such foul sustenance. Those willing to debase themselves are said to do it through a combination of poisons, each acting against the other. First, {clr3}foxglove: the dead man's bells{clr3}. Second, {clr3}belladonna: the beautiful lady{clr3}. Third, {clr3}a calabar bean: the ordeal{clr3}."
      - {clr3}"Chapter 13: he who murders babes{clr3}
        The cruelest creatures live off the souls of the innocent. Not simply destroying, but desecrating. Not only killing, but damning. A soul torn loose this way will never know peace, for it persists after consumption. Even when the foul creature is killed, the souls trapped within it seep out with its blood and suffer forever in the soiled ground."
    }
  - else ?
    This old book has a black cover.
    
    You open it to find {clr3}it's completely empty{clr3}. You can't find a single word inside, though the cover and pages are well worn.
}
"""

DLG SPR_12
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    The burned books are covered in {clr3}splotches of yellow light{clr3}, like ink. You open one up, and read some of the more intact pages:
    "Thelma, killed with a knife, resolute until the end."
    "Katherine, poisoned over tea, begged for death."
    "Rebecca, slit throat, forgave me eventually."
    "Nellie, suffocated, fought back."
    The list goes on, until the pages are black and crumbling.
  - else ?
    What?
    
    All the books on this shelf are badly burnt. You can't even make out the titles. Why would she keep these?
}
"""

DLG SPR_13
This shelf has a couple of photo albums. There are a few photos of a young Birdi, all black and white and very old. Then there are a lot of photos of older Birdi, photos of the lighthouse, and photos of the ocean.

    The warm drink goes down easy, but leaves your mouth dry. You tip the kettle back, but the mixture glides down your throat without easing your thirst.
    
    You wonder for a moment if you'll live, and then the true effects begin.                                               
    
    
    (endNow "{shk}Your heartbeat begins to dance. It slows down almost to the point of stopping, only to pick up again at an irregular pace.{shk} Its rhythm makes you dizzy. There is a ringing in your ears that slowly turns to screaming. Voices shout all around you: some cursing, some demanding. Sciophyte, they say, death dealer. You slip into silence and sleep, then come back out, hot and sore and covered in sweat, like from a fever. You pull yourself up and outside. The sun is up now, not burning, but uncomfortably bright. Whatever mysteries are still inside that house, they don't matter now. You understand enough.")
  - addherb == 3 ?
    (exitNow "red,0,0")(endNow "You drink it down to the last drop, and it doesn't take long for the effects to take hold. You start to vomit up the mixture you just drank, but too late. {shk}Your body collapses and then convulses, muscles fighting to keep your soul inside. It's no use.     Y(exitNow "yellow,11,11")ou're suddenly blinded by lights from all around you. 
    You close your eyes, trying to block them out, but your skin, your hat, your hands, nothing makes a difference. 
    The light is inside you as well. 
    
    Slowly, the light fades into a warm yellow, covering everything around you. It's as if you're looking through a colored lens. You blink a few times, and soon the golden tint begins to fade. 
    Soon, it's as if nothing has changed, but you know it has. Somewhere, somehow, something has changed. You just have to {clr1}keep your eyes open.{clr1}(exit "litkitchen,5,6")
  - mary * owner == 1 ?
    {water = 0}

    The taste is mild and somewhat green. Your head begins to hurt, and you instinctively close your eyes tight.(exitNow "black,11,11")
    {rbw}Colors swirl behind your eyes, solidifying into shapes.
    You see the kitchen, a newly bleeding Birdi slumped against the bricks, with a small figure behind her, shaking. The child is crying, but her face is determined. She reaches carefully into Birdi's pocket, and pulls out a black key. She runs inside the pantry, shoving the key inside a moldy jar of flour.{rbw} From there, the vision begins to fade, unwinding itself until there's nothing but darkness behind your eyes.

    The taste is mild and somewhat green. Your head begins to hurt, and you instinctively close your eyes tight.(exitNow "black,11,11")
    {rbw}Colors swirl behind your eyes{rbw}, almost taking shape, but then they dissipate. Nothing else happens, but then again no one has stolen anything from you.

  - addherb == 1 ?
    (exitNow "red,0,0")(endNow "You drink it down to the last drop, and it doesn't take long for the effects to take hold. You are jerked forcefully from your mortal shell, into darkness.{shk}")

    You haven't added anything yet!

"""

DLG SPR_2l
"""
There are sheets of loose paper on this table. Despite the absolute darkness, {clr3}you can read the words perfectly{clr3}.
{cycle
  - "One minute he was here, and then the next, empty. Emptied. The blood is his. It was in defense of myself, so why do I feel guilt at times? I picture him sneering at me, drawing his knife, and it fades a little.
    
    I may be a monster, but he made it this way, thought he was better off with me dead. He told me, knife in hand, that I was nothing more than food. 
    
    I will have to prove him wrong now."
  - "It must be tonight. I have made all the beginning preparations, and saved a bit of myself for consumption. I can have the girl over in a matter of hours, then all I must do is make sure that she takes the soul into her, and that this body perishes. Given enough time, I can be sure of both things."
  - "Jonathan tells me that our endeavors will pay off soon. 
    Our research is coming to an end, and on the other side we shall have eternal life. We will be together forever, watching the world change while we remain steadfast to study its turning. I am excited and nervous at what these transformations will do."
}
"""

DLG SPR_2m
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    You flip through the coloring book, and scattered among the pages are {clr3}words and short sentences{clr3}. Towards the back it says, {clr3}"Aunt Birdi taught me a new trick!"{clr3} Each page is signed {clr3}"Rosa"{clr3}.
  - else ?
    It's a child's coloring book.
    
    You flip through it, and about half the pages are colored. Whoever colored it did a good job, if you can call it that. The colors make sense and they all fit within the lines.
}
"""

DLG SPR_2n
"""
There are sheets of loose paper on this table. Despite the absolute darkness, {clr3}you can read the words perfectly{clr3}.
{cycle
  - "His soul has begun to speak to me, like a fracture, like a root sprouting new leaves. I fear that in time, the other souls will learn to do the same, ghosts haunting the inside of my mind forever, trees growing where there is no space. 
    Of course there was no one to teach me that this could be the outcome of my sins, and the only one who might have known has offered me no explanation in his wailing.
    I try my best to block him out, but occasionally it throws me into a rage, one that is only ended by killing. His voice walks across my brain like a crawling insect."
  - "If only I did not have this ghost haunting me. He has gotten louder now, taunting me, berating me, smug in his defiance and his existence.
    
    I have been resisting my urge to kill in strange ways. I have been sketching more, mostly images of him in agony, so he can watch and I can imagine an end to him. Sometimes it helps, but if it doesn't then I burn the image. I have been burning many things lately.
    
    I wish to leave soon."
  - "What would a normal life have been like? I can hardly imagine. Is it right to live when so many others must die? I don't deserve to exist, but I exist. There is no hope now, but was there any before? Can I say there was more meaning then, knowing my death was unpredictable? What a stupid thought."
}
"""

DLG SPR_2p
"""
{
  - bones == 1 ?
    There are so many.
  - else ?
    In the darkness you almost trip over a pile of something. A few somethings fall lightly to the ground. You reach out to feel what's near your feet. You don't recognize the shape until you feel the human teeth attached to the jaw. {bones = 1}
}
"""

DLG SPR_2q
"""
{
  - bones == 1 ?
    There are so many.
  - else ?
    In the darkness you almost trip over a pile of something. A few somethings fall lightly to the ground. You reach out to feel what's near your feet. You don't recognize the shape until you feel the human teeth attached to the jaw. {bones = 1}
}
"""

DLG SPR_2r
"""
{
  - bones == 1 ?
    There are so many.
  - else ?
    In the darkness you almost trip over a pile of something. A few somethings fall lightly to the ground. You reach out to feel what's near your feet. You don't recognize the shape until you feel the human teeth attached to the jaw. {bones = 1}
}
"""

DLG SPR_2s
In the corner you find a small bottle, stopped up with a cork. (exit "basement2,10,6")(image "SPR, A, select")

DLG SPR_2t
(exit "basement,6,8")(image "SPR, A, man")You leave the bottle alone for now.

DLG SPR_2u
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    The paintings look same, except for the portrait of the man. {clr3}He's smiling and his ribs are cracked open, his organs spilling out into his hands.{clr3}
  - else ?
    Leaning up against the wall are some paintings. They're all in a similar, rough style.
    There are two paintings of the lighthouse: one facing the sea, the other facing away. There are also a few still life studies, and one portrait of a young man in outdated clothes.
}
"""

DLG SPR_2v
"""
The chests are small but sturdy, made of wood and iron, with very little rust. You open up the first one.
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    The rabbit figurine is covered in {clr3}intricate patterns{clr3} that don't mean anything to you.
  - else ?
    Inside are several small figurines of animals: a bird, a deer, a bear, a cat, and a rabbit. They're made of iron. You can't tell if they're supposed to toys or decorations. Given their rough construction, they wouldn't do well as either.
}
"""

DLG SPR_2y
(exitNow "black,11,11")(end "You pick up the bottle, careful not to drop it in the darkness. You pull out the cork and swallow the contents in a sip. The darkness remains, but there is {clr2}a light{clr2} inside you filling unused spaces in your mind, stitching memories together where none were before. The effect is slow and gentle, a voice like dry leaves crackling your own name in your ear. You speak {clr2}her name{clr2} in reply. The girl has left, but you will be her vessel now. There is a quiet, and in it the comfort that it is only the two of you. You speak, together, a string of words like warm chamomile. The basement door creaks inwards, and {clr2}you are both free{clr2}.")

DLG SPR_2z
(exitNow "black,11,11")(end "{shk}Your hands shake with hesitation as you pick up the small bottle.{shk} You know what it is, you know {clr2}who{clr2} it is. Regardless of the circumstances, or the reasons, or the excuses, that woman was a murderer. You'll be damned before you let those crimes go unpunished. At the very least, you won't give her the chance to escape using {clr2}someone else's body.{clr2} You hold the bottle above your head and throw it to the ground, crushing the remains under your heel to be sure. The door remains closed and in the dark, you wait.")

DLG SPR_v
This bookcase is empty, but there are lines of dust between the spaces where books used to be.

DLG SPR_30
"""
{
  - thief == 1 ?
    Your stare is empty and unfocused. You avoid the mirror.
  - sight == 1 ?
    {cycle
      - For a second, you think you see smoke drifting out of your mouth, but you blink, and the image is gone.
      - For a second, you think you see blood on the table behind you, but you turn around, and there's nothing there.
    }
  - else ?
    You catch a glimpse of yourself in the mirror.
    {cycle
      - You look like you really wish you weren't out of cigarettes, which to the mirror's credit is spot on.
      - At least your hat and coat still look good wet.
      - You should probably shave soon, or just let it grow out?
      - You look tired.
      - You look like you need a pill, so you take one from the bottle in your pocket and swallow it dry.
      - Hey there, handsome, come here often?
    }
}
"""

DLG SPR_31
"""
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    You can see {clr3}faded, old writing{clr3} circling the fireplace. It's almost entirely illegible, but appears to be a sort of blessing. The letters are warm to the touch.
  - else ?

}
"""

DLG SPR_32
"""
Unless there's something in the basement that you don't know about, this place doesn't have a bedroom or a bathroom.
You're not sure what to make of that.
"""

DLG SPR_1x
You hope there aren't any ships out there tonight.

DLG SPR_36
(exitNow "hallway,7,7")

DLG SPR_37
(exitNow "stairs,9,7")

DLG SPR_38
"""
There are notes from the local police scattered on the table. It's unprofessional, but these might give you more information.
{cycle
  - "Name: Birdi Clarkson
    Age: approximately 90
    Cause of death: Possible injury to the head from falling
    Body was found in the kitchen, in front of the fireplace."
  - "The deceased lived alone, with no next of kin. We're unable to find any social security, pension, income, taxes or other records. The only legal paperwork available is the {clr3}deed to the lighthouse{clr3}, which was found near her art supplies."
  - "The pantry and the basement are both locked. We'll have to get a locksmith out here if we want to open those, which won't be until morning. It can probably wait."
  - "There were several small sets of prints found all around the kitchen, possibly belonging to a child. The nearest neighbors are two miles away, but we'll need to question them and see if they have a kid. We're going to call in a detective from the city to give the place a thorough sweep."
    
    That'd be you.
}
"""

DLG SPR_39
"""
{sequence
  - Hey, what are you doing over here? If you aren't sure what to do, maybe come back when you have some more clues!
  - Can't you just stick to the story? It took me forever to work out this menu screen, so please head back down there!
  - Please just let a bunny be!
}
"""

DLG SPR_2o
"""
{water = 0}
{addherb = 0}
{mary = 0}
{sini = 0}
{fox = 0}
{bean = 0}
{bella = 0}(image "SPR, A, man")(image "SPR, addm, add")(image "SPR, adds, add")(image "SPR, addf, add")(image "SPR, addo, add")(image "SPR, addb, add")(exit "litkitchen,5,6")You drink the marigold, trying your best not to smell it. 
The taste is mild and somewhat green. Your head begins to hurt, and you instinctively close your eyes tight. 
{rbw}Colors swirl behind your eyes{rbw}, almost taking shape, but then they dissipate. Nothing else happens, but then again no one has stolen anything from you.
"""

DLG SPR_2x
"""
It's an easel with an unfinished painting of a young girl.
{
  - thief == 1 ?
    You recognize her as the girl from the vision. 
  - sight == 1 ?
    {clr3}The features of a younger Birdi are covering her face.{clr3}
  - else ?
    She has short, curly, dark brown hair. She's smiling.
}
"""

DLG SPR_3a
"""
{sequence
  - An old crate full of art supplies. There are paints and brushes as well as some charcoal, and other stuff that means nothing to you cause you don't do art.
  - It's an old crate full of art supplies.
}
"""

DLG SPR_3b
"""
{
  - knowmari == 1 ?
    You pick up {clr3}the deed{clr3} again. When you're holding this, does it mean you own the house? That's a strange thought
  - else ?
    These are the papers that the police found when they were searching the house. You pick one up.
    {cycle
      - This is an old letter, addressed to Birdi by name, talking about the purchase of the lighthouse. It's not very interesting.
      - This is the {clr3}deed to the lighthouse{clr3}. It lists Birdi as the owner, but she signed it like she were giving it away. That's odd.
    }
}
"""

DLG SPR_3c
"""
{
  - deed == 1 ?
    No point looking at this.
  - knowmari == 1 ?
    {owner = 1}
{deed = 1}You pick up {clr3}the deed{clr3}. When you're holding this, does it mean you own the house? That's a strange thought, but it gives you an idea. You stuff it in your coat.(image "SPR, paperwork, onepaper")
  - else ?
    These are the papers that the police found when they were searching the house. You pick one up.
    {cycle
      - This is the {clr3}deed to the lighthouse{clr3}. It lists Birdi as the owner, but she signed it like she was giving it away. That's odd.
      - This is an old letter, addressed to Birdi by name, talking about the purchase of the lighthouse. It's not very interesting.
    }
}
"""

DLG SPR_2w
"""
The chests are small but sturdy, made of wood and iron, with very little rust. You pull open up the second one.
{
  - sight == 1 ?
    The sketches of people all have dates and times listed on them. Some of them have names. The blank papers are now full of self portraits: {clr3}Birdi crying, Birdi cutting off her own head, Birdi holding a man in her arms, Birdi strangling a young girl{clr3}. No wonder she hid these away.
  - else ?
    This chest is full of paper for drawing. Unlike the paintings, these sketches are mostly people. There are children laughing, groups of people sitting and talking, others standing stiffly. You riffle through them, but it's only sketches and {clr3}blank sheets of paper{clr3}.
}
"""

DLG SPR_3d
"""
{sequence
  - An old crate full of art supplies. There are paints and brushes as well as some charcoal, and other stuff that means nothing to you because you don't do art.
  - It's an old crate full of art supplies.
}
"""

(imageNow "SPR, hintbunny, bunny")Hey, what are you doing up here? You should probably get inside!

DLG SPR_3f
You've seen lighthouses before, but they were all newer than this one. The lens is enormous, taller than you are. It reminds you of a beautiful, jeweled egg.

  - sight == 1 ?

    You turn away before you start to cry.
  - else ?
    You've seen lighthouses before, but they were all newer than this one. The lens is enormous, taller than you are. It reminds you of a beautiful, jeweled egg.
